topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1: Uploading and Downloading Objects

body.p: An object is the basic storage entity that represents a file you store in the OpenStack(R) Object Storage system. When you upload data to OpenStack(R) Object Storage, the data is stored as-is (no compression or encryption) and consists of a location (container), the object's name, and any metadata consisting of key/value pairs

section.title: Uploading an object into a container

li.p: Launch the HPE Helion OpenStack(R) Helion Dashboard.
Click the Object Store tab on the dashboard Project panel.
In the Object Store panel, click Containers.
Select the container in which you want to store your object.
The Upload Object To Container: <name> dialog box is displayed. <name> is the name of the container to which you are uploading the object.
Enter a name for the object.
Browse to and select the file that you want to upload.
Launch the HPE Helion OpenStack(R) Helion Dashboard.
Click the Object Store tab on the dashboard Project panel.
In the Object Store panel, click Containers.
Select the container from which you want to download the object.
Click Download next to the object to download the file to your local drive.
